Estimate alpha diversity

Source: R/estimateDiversity.R
estimateDiversity.Rd

Several functions for calculation of alpha diversity indices available via wrapper functions. They are implemented via the vegan package.

estimateDiversity(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  index = c("shannon", "simpson", "inv_simpson", "richness", "chao1", "ACE",
    "coverage"),
  name = index,
  ...
)

estimateAlphaDiversity(x, ...)

estimateShannon(x, ...)

estimateSimpson(x, ...)

estimateInvSimpson(x, ...)

estimateRichness(x, ...)

estimateCoverage(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateDiversity(
  x,
  abund_values = "counts",
  index = c("shannon", "simpson", "inv_simpson", "richness", "chao1", "ACE",
    "coverage"),
  name = index,
  ...,
  BPPARAM = SerialParam()
)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateAlphaDiversity(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateShannon(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateSimpson(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateInvSimpson(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateRichness(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
estimateCoverage(x, ...)

Arguments

x

a SummarizedExperiment object
abund_values

the name of the assay used for calculation of the sample-wise estimates
index

a diversity measurement
name

a name for the column of the colData the results should be stored in.
...

additional parameters passed to estimateDiversity

  • threshold is a numeric value for selecting threshold for coverage index. By default, the threshold is 0.9.
BPPARAM

A BiocParallelParam object specifying whether calculation of estimates should be parallelized.

Value

x with additional colData named *name*

Details

These include the ‘Shannon’, ‘Simpson’ and ‘inverse Simpson’ diversity measures.

See also

plotColData

  • diversity

  • estimateR

Examples

data(GlobalPatterns)
se <- GlobalPatterns

se <- estimateShannon(se)
colData(se)$shannon

#>      CL3      CC1      SV1  M31Fcsw  M11Fcsw  M31Plmr  M11Plmr  F21Plmr 
#> 6.576517 6.776603 6.498494 3.828368 3.287666 4.289269 4.849999 4.874747 
#>  M31Tong  M11Tong LMEpi24M SLEpi20M   AQC1cm   AQC4cm   AQC7cm      NP2 
#> 2.672103 3.905419 3.093981 3.651142 3.552736 3.372495 4.027716 4.230515 
#>      NP3      NP5  TRRsed1  TRRsed2  TRRsed3     TS28     TS29    Even1 
#> 4.483806 4.563943 6.157462 4.869817 5.461840 4.126538 3.452772 4.083665 
#>    Even2    Even3 
#> 3.956909 4.006375 

se <- estimateSimpson(se)
colData(se)$simpson

#>       CL3       CC1       SV1   M31Fcsw   M11Fcsw   M31Plmr   M11Plmr   F21Plmr 
#> 0.9946561 0.9952117 0.9962900 0.9275989 0.9097382 0.9379114 0.9518733 0.9777509 
#>   M31Tong   M11Tong  LMEpi24M  SLEpi20M    AQC1cm    AQC4cm    AQC7cm       NP2 
#> 0.8625384 0.9358927 0.8023279 0.9072187 0.7648870 0.7397659 0.8179374 0.9532320 
#>       NP3       NP5   TRRsed1   TRRsed2   TRRsed3      TS28      TS29     Even1 
#> 0.9718016 0.9748733 0.9924388 0.9640962 0.9815843 0.9651752 0.9180976 0.9681981 
#>     Even2     Even3 
#> 0.9639157 0.9673405 

# Calculates all the diversity indices
se <- estimateDiversity(se)

#> 'Threshold' value of 0.9 was used to calculate 'coverage' index. It is the default value.
# All the indices' names
indices <- c("shannon","simpson","inv_simpson", "richness", "chao1", "ACE", "coverage")
colData(se)[,indices]

#> DataFrame with 26 rows and 7 columns
#>           shannon   simpson inv_simpson  richness     chao1       ACE  coverage
#>         <numeric> <numeric>   <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <integer>
#> CL3       6.57652  0.994656    187.1298      6964   8588.07   8307.26      1113
#> CC1       6.77660  0.995212    208.8436      7679   9236.47   9150.22      1374
#> SV1       6.49849  0.996290    269.5441      5729   7266.10   7276.83       829
#> M31Fcsw   3.82837  0.927599     13.8119      2667   4089.81   4212.00        71
#> M11Fcsw   3.28767  0.909738     11.0789      2574   4178.12   4231.06        37
#> ...           ...       ...         ...       ...       ...       ...       ...
#> TS28      4.12654  0.965175     28.7152      2679   4540.94   4458.45        62
#> TS29      3.45277  0.918098     12.2097      2629   4225.33   4343.57        46
#> Even1     4.08366  0.968198     31.4447      4213   6643.39   6657.88        51
#> Even2     3.95691  0.963916     27.7129      3130   5258.56   5494.46        47
#> Even3     4.00637  0.967340     30.6189      2776   4651.05   4790.45        49

# plotting the diversities
library(scater)

#> Loading required package: ggplot2
plotColData(se, "shannon")

# ... by sample type
plotColData(se, "shannon", "SampleType")

# \donttest{
# combining different plots
plots <- lapply(c("shannon","simpson"),
                plotColData,
                object = se,
                x = "SampleType",
                colour_by = "SampleType")
plots <- lapply(plots,"+", theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=45,hjust=1)))
ggpubr::ggarrange(plotlist = plots, nrow = 1, common.legend = TRUE, legend = "right")

# }
